name: oppgcntr
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: 3eqtr3i(c0, cfv(ccntr, c1), cfv(cfv(ccntz, c2), cfv(cbs, c2)), cfv(cfv(ccntz, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(ccntr, c1))
-| wceq(cfv(cfv(ccntz, c2), cfv(cbs, c2)), cfv(cfv(ccntz, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)))
-| wceq(cfv(cfv(ccntz, c2), cfv(cbs, c2)), c0)
-| wceq(cfv(cfv(ccntz, c1), cfv(cbs, c2)), cfv(ccntr, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 =(Cntr ` c1)
⊣ ((Cntz ` c2)`(Base ` c2))=((Cntz ` c1)`(Base ` c2))
⊣ ((Cntz ` c2)`(Base ` c2))= c0
⊣ ((Cntz ` c1)`(Base ` c2))=(Cntr ` c1)

comment: The center of a group is the same as the center of the opposite group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)
